alert.note: Alert for Central Oahu; East Honolulu; Kahoolawe; Kauai Mountains; Kauai South; Kauai Southwest; Koolau Leeward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai Leeward South; Molokai North; Molokai Southeast; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Waianae Coast; Waianae Mountains (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 27 at 3:36AM HST until February 28 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TUESDAY FOR WINDIER AREAS OF MOST ISLANDS... .A very strong high pressure system far north of the Hawaiian Islands will produce strong and gusty trade winds through much of the coming work week. Wind speeds will exceed advisory threshold across many parts of the state at least through Tuesday. ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...East winds 25 to 35 mph with localized gusts up to 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Kahoolawe, Kauai, Maui, Molokai and Oahu. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make it difficult to drive, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
